text: Domingo Villar (6 March 1971 – 18 May 2022) was a Spanish crime writer. He was born and raised in Vigo, Galicia, Spain. He was known for his novels about Inspector Leo Caldas his assistant Rafael Estévez. Many of his books were published in Galician before being translated into Spanish. Villar died in Vigo on 18 May 2022 from a stroke he had two days before, at the age of 51. ==References== Category:1971 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Spanish writers Category:Crime writers
